StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [sp_DeleteCandidateASVAB]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@MarineCandidateID int, @ASVABDate date.me, @Version varchar(3), @UserLogin varchar(15) AS
SET NOCOUNT ON
DECLARE @TranType varchar(8) DECLARE @ErrMsg varchar(100) DECLARE @SSN char(9) DECLARE @DBID int DECLARE @DBNAME sysname
SELECT @DBID = DB_ID(), @DBNAME = DB_NAME()
IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM CANDIDATE_ASVAB CA WHERE CA.MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @MarineCandidateId AND VERSION = @Version AND ASVAB_DATE = @ASVABDate) BEGIN SET @TranType = 'dele.ng'
--- update the user login before dele.ng so the TLog will record the user that deleted the record UPDATE CANDIDATE_ASVAB SET USER_LOGIN = @UserLogin, UPDATE_DATE = GETDATE() WHERE MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @MarineCandidateId AND VERSION = @Version AND ASVAB_DATE = @ASVABDate
DELETE FROM CANDIDATE_ASVAB WHERE MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @MarineCandidateId AND VERSION = @Version AND ASVAB_DATE = @ASVABDate
IF @@ERROR != 0 OR @@ROWCOUNT = 0 BEGIN SELECT @SSN = SOCIAL_SECURITY_NUMBER FROM PERSON WHERE PERSON_ID = @MarineCandidateID
SET @ErrMsg = 'An error occurred ' + @TranType + ' the ASVAB record for SSN ' + @SSN + '.' RAISERROR (@ErrMsg, 16, 1, @DBID, @DBNAME) RETURN END END
SET NOCOUNT OFF
